items: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding an agility ball in both hands.
Take a step forward with your left foot and simultaneously throw the ball against a wall or to a partner.
Catch the ball with both hands and quickly step back with your left foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat the same movement with your right foot, stepping forward and throwing the ball.
Continue alternating between your left and right foot, throwing the ball as quickly and accurately as possible.
Try to maintain a steady rhythm and increase your speed as you become more comfortable with the exercise.
Perform the agility ball drill for 30-60 seconds, rest for 10-15 seconds, and repeat for 3-4 sets.
Strengthens leg muscles, including quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes
Can be done anywhere without equipment
Helps with functional movements, such as sitting and standing
Can be modified for different fitness levels
